Good Morning! The advisory tweets now excerpts from the president's address at the International Construction Show in São Paulo.
RT @TVNBR: President @dilmabr addresses the opening of @feiconbatimat. Stay tuned for @TVNBR http://t.co/p3mX3NcIFQ
I was very interested in participating in the opening of the International Construction Exhibition. This fair is an important reference for the sector.
RT @blogplanalto: Dilma: I am sure that the business exchange will contribute to strengthen the construction in Latin America.
At the time q was launched, #PAC was the first major infrastructure program of the last 25 years.
Brazil has transformed itself and made public works one of the factors of expansion of the economy.
We mobilize public resources to invest in highways, railways, ports, airports, energy, basic sanitation, water security.
With #MinhaCasaMinhaVida, we face the challenge of guaranteeing access to our own home to Brazilians previously excluded from the real estate market.
Construction of houses and apartments throughout Brazil means demand for construction.
It has great significance because it generates employment, ensures an improvement in the conditions of life and in the Brazilian economy.
All this was done and allowed the construction to become one of the engines of growth in Brazil in recent years.
I make this balance because the current situation, more difficult, but can not overshadow the advances, nor obscure that we have today the bases (...)
(...) and the learning to go much further, to give even greater leaps of production and competitiveness.
It is true that Brazil is going through a difficult time, but we are not living a crisis of dimensions that some say we are living
We go through strictly conjunctural problems, because our foundation is solid.
We no longer have a crisis that breaks down and paralyzes the country. We are able to move to another level.
RT @TVNBR: "Without making some adjustments, we will not be able to keep up the pace of growth" - Dilma Rousseff in speech @feiconbatimat

RT @portalbrasil: Dilma: We seek to ensure the resumption of growth and employment by keeping programs important for the country and for the ...
As we have done in all previous steps, let us listen to suggestions from the productive sector to define the improvements.
We are making adjustments, but we do not let go of establishing, simultaneously, the conditions for a competitive and dynamic economy.
RT @portalbrasil: Dilma: I assure you that we will continue to support the dynamism and competitiveness of the construction sector.
We are taking the corrective and corrective measures to return to the past, but because we think it is possible, yes, we are even better than we were
We are able to overcome all the challenges that lie ahead.

LIVE: President Obama is talking to students at @GeorgiaTech about how to make college in America more affordable. http://t.co/8Nb4gVygp2
"I believe that higher education is one of the best investments anybody can make in their future." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
"After the worst economic crisis of our lifetimes, over the past five years our economy has created 12 million new jobs." —President Obama
"Today a college degree is the surest ticket to the middle class." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
"Your most valuable asset is your imagination." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
"The ability to compete in the global economy depends on us having the world's most skilled, best educated workforce."  —President Obama
"I believe America is not a place where higher education is a privilege reserved for the few." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
"I'm only standing here because of scholarships and loans and work study." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
"I sent Congress a bold new plan to bring down the cost of community college to zero." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
"We're trying to make sure that across the board more and more young people can afford to go to college." —President Obama
"You're not just investing in yourself—you're investing in your nation." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
"Change doesn't happen by itself. It happens because people get organized." —President Obama
Europe bears a special responsibility for ensuring that we will never forget. @HolocaustMuseum http://t.co/4ruTGWqqC2
I take the floor today at this historic meeting first and foremost to pay tribute to the victims of the Second World War.
To honor all the fighters and fighters from all over the world who gave their lives to defeat Nazism.
"Inspire us. Lead us. Be the Americans that we need you to be." —President Obama #CollegeOpportunity
To honor the fighters of the Greek national resistance who gave their lives to rid our country of the Nazi atrocities.
"No matter who you are or where you come from, not only can you succeed, but you can help everybody else succeed." —President Obama
Which people can go forward by extinguishing the collective memory and leaving historically unjust their struggles and sacrifices?
The peoples of Europe and their leaders must remember and draw conclusions from modern European history.
We will approach the subject with the necessary sensitivity, with a sense of responsibility and sincerity, with a conciliation and dialogue.
The same, however, we expect from the German Government. For political, historical, symbolic and moral reasons.
We choose the way to negotiate. We do not waive our inalienable claims.
The Greek government will work to keep all unfulfilled obligations to Greece and the Greek people intact.
As we are committed to meeting our obligations so they have to do & all sides. Why ethics can not be hello.
We are ready to offer every kind of political and legal assistance so that the Commission's efforts can be successful.
We owe it to Europe and its peoples who have the right to remember and to a future liberated from all sorts of totalitarianism.
